description: Two large bears are preparing what appears to be a meal, shaking small human-like figures from a tree. One bear holds several figures, while the other shakes the tree trunk. The dialogue treats the arrival of more figures as merely adding another guest to a gathering, highlighting the absurd indifference to the figures' fate. This juxtaposition of mundane conversation with a predatory act creates dark humor. The scene is set in a clearing with a single tree and discarded surgical implements.
caption: “Let's see ... I guess your brother's coming over, too—better give it one more shake.”
